p: Results show that ecological resistance for the majority of species is similar in present and future conditions with the exception of B. trifoliolata and E. aspera where the ecological resistance will increase in future conditions. Ecological resistance can reduce functional connectivity and gene flow between populations ( McRae & Beier, 2007; Spear et al., 2010; Peterman et al., 2014) and might affect genetic structure. Likewise, lower resistance leads to higher dispersal for individuals ( Cushman et al., 2006). Thus the rest of species might be affected in connectivity among populations in future scenarios of climate change.
